newsitem.title: USA: ADR REPORT - European ADRs firm in New York.
newsitem.headline: ADR REPORT - European ADRs firm in New York.

text.p: European companies' American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) were mostly higher on Wednesday as Wall Street digested an increase in interest rates.
"The dollar holding at higher levels has encouraged the European markets to steady up a bit. It feels good right now," a trader said, adding that there was little news moving ADRS.
Among European shares, Swedish telephone equipment company LM Ericsson rose one to 34-3/4 amid a general rise in technology stocks. Finnish telecommunications company Nokia Group was up 1-3/8 to 61.

Singapore software company Creative Technology Ltd fell 1/2 to 9-1/8. The company was the most-active ADR with almost two million shares traded by midday, but traders said most of the activity was in big blocks.
"Anybody that has stock to sell has to get involved at this (price) level," a trader said.
Latin American bellwether Telefonos de Mexico was unchanged at 39-1/2.
Decliners led advancers by 253 to 204 among 806 ADRs. The ADR index was up 0.56 percent and volume was 30.5 million shares by early afternoon.
